data.chText: 受到热爱和崇拜的人（或物）；偶像
data.enText: a person or thing that is loved and admired very much

data.chText: 流行音乐偶像、足球明星、青少年的偶像等
无数十几岁青少年崇拜的偶像

data.enText: a fallen idol (= sb who is no longer popular)
a statue that is worshipped as a god

means: 受到热爱和崇拜的人(或物)

tr: a material effigy that is worshipped
example: thou shalt not make unto thee any graven image

tr: a perfect embodiment of a concept
someone who is adored blindly and excessively

value.def: If you refer to someone such as a film, pop, or sports star as an idol, you mean that they are greatly admired or loved by their fans.

example.ex: A great cheer went up from the crowd as they caught sight of their idol...
example.tran: 一看到他们的偶像,人群爆发出热烈的欢呼声。

example.ex: He looks more like a stockbroker than a teen idol.
example.tran: 他看起来不像是青少年偶像，而更像个股票经纪人。

value.def: An idol is a statue or other object that is worshipped by people who believe that it is a god.
If you refer to someone as a fallen idol, you mean that they have lost people's respect and admiration because of something bad that they have done.

example.ex: He was once worshipped like a god but is now a fallen idol.
example.tran: 他曾像神一样受崇拜,如今却成了堕落的偶像。

trans: 美国偶像；美國偶像；冠军；第八季；海选
盛行偶像；大众偶像；流行偶像；风行偶像；歌星偶像
偶像崇拜；偶像崇拜话题；崇拜偶像

rootsaffixes.indicate: = image, idol 形象, 偶像
rootsaffixes.title: idol

partsOfSpeech.dec: idolatr〔y〕偶像崇拜 + ous …的 → 崇拜偶像的
idol 形象，偶像 + atry → 偶像崇拜
idol 形象，偶像 + ize 使… → 使偶像化 → 崇拜
